resources.string: How to get to the office:

string.name: open_map
string.u: Click here to open in GoogleMaps App

resources.string: Prague has one of the best public transportation systems in Europe. The Prague City Transport Authority (DPP) includes metro (subway), trams and buses and it covers majority of the city and outskirts. \n\nPublic transport in Prague is easy, reliable and affordable. Metro operates from around 4:45am till midnight, however there are night trams and buses.

Short term tickets: 
30 minutes: 24 CZK
90 minutes: 32 CZK
24 hours: 110 CZK
72 hours: 310 CZK 

Remember to validate your ticket! 

Transferable long term passes: 
Monthly: 670 CZK
Quaterly: 1880 CZK
Annual: 6100CZK 

Long term passes for Litačka holders: 
Monthly: 550 CZK
Quaterly: 1480 CZK
5-months: 2450 CZK
Annual: 3650 CZK 

All children under 6 and seniors over 70 years old may use the public transportation for free. 
Children between 6 and 15 years old have discounts.
Ticket vending machines are installed in all metro stations and at selected surface transit stops (click to see the list). They are intended for the purchase of individual (short term) tickets.
You can also just click here and download the app in which you can buy tickets.

The Litačka Prague travel card (Litačka sounds like "litachka") is a transport card designed to be used by adults for periods of between one month and one year. 

To get Litačka card you'll need to go to Skoda Palace at Jungmannova 35/29, Prague 1 with a passport-sized photo. There is a fee of 200 CZK for the "on the go" card. 

You can also order Litačka via online application (click) and have your card sent to one of the contact points or by post to home address.
